item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 26, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. NKRYPT Sculpture (37 points | discuss)
2. The Slow, Painful Death of Agile and Jira (16 points | 3 comments)
3. Xkcd 1425 (Tasks) turns ten years old today (707 points | 318 comments)
4. Italian Music Through the Lens of Complex Networks (44 points | 4 comments)

6. Orion, our first true augmented reality glasses (1080 points | 850 comments)
7. OpenAI to Become For-Profit Company (496 points | 269 comments)
8. Llama 3.2: Revolutionizing edge AI and vision with open, customizable models (758 points | 247 comments)
9. Git-absorb: Git commit –fixup, but automatic (331 points | 164 comments)
10. Show HN: Cronexpr, a Rust library to parse and iter crontab expression (112 points | 20 comments)
11. Poka Labs (YC S24) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer ( | hide)
12. Pilots Are Dying of Tiredness. Tech Can't Save Them (27 points | 23 comments)
13. Hoodmaps: Publicly Annotated City Maps (100 points | 44 comments)
14. Octopuses seen hunting together with fish, punching those that don't cooperate (146 points | 109 comments)
15. Launch HN: Haystack (YC S24) – Visualize and edit code on an infinite canvas (290 points | 149 comments)
16. PostgreSQL 17 Released (144 points | 18 comments)
17. Rents Fall and Listings Increase After Milei Ends Rent Control in Argentina (7 points | 1 comment)
18. Ask HN: What tools should I use to manage secrets from env files? (14 points | 20 comments)
19. Eliminating Memory Safety Vulnerabilities at the Source (262 points | 125 comments)
20. Sensorwatch pro – Hackable ARM Cortex M0 brain upgrade for Casio's iconic F-91W (8 points | discuss)
21. Shizuku: App that lets you use system APIs with higher privileges without root (53 points | 19 comments)
22. The lost language extensions of MetaWare's High C compiler (2023) (282 points | 90 comments)
23. Vehicles Could Be Hacked and Tracked Thanks to a Simple Website Bug (25 points | 11 comments)
24. GitHub-events-viewer a.k.a. "What did I do yesterday?" (53 points | 14 comments)
25. Writing Portable Rendering Code with Nvrhi (17 points | 2 comments)
26. Timeshare owner? The Mexican drug cartels want you (211 points | 240 comments)
27. Moerenuma Park: A Giant, Gorgeous 'Living Sculpture' in Hokkaido (39 points | 6 comments)
28. Show HN: Httpdbg – A tool to trace the HTTP requests sent by your Python code (168 points | 47 comments)
29. Another new wasp species discovered by researchers (9 points | 10 comments)
30. Why I still blog after 15 years (424 points | 211 comments)
